abstract: Specify whether the target Metal layer has been configured for EDR output.
overview:
## Discussion

If the Metal layer that this [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityRenderer] will be rendering into has been configured to output extended dynamic range content (i.e. the property `QuartzCore/CAMetalLayer/wantsExtendedDynamicRangeContent` on the target `QuartzCore/CAMetalLayer` has been set to `true` and a pixel format that supports EDR content has been set), this property should be set to `true` so that [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityRenderer] adjusts its tone mapping accordingly.

To control the amount of headroom available for extended dynamic range content, see [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityRenderer/extendedDynamicRangeHeadroom].

The default value is `false`.

# extendedDynamicRangeOutput

**Instance Property**

Specify whether the target Metal layer has been configured for EDR output.

## Declaration

```swift
var extendedDynamicRangeOutput: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the Metal layer that this [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityRenderer] will be rendering into has been configured to output extended dynamic range content (i.e. the property `QuartzCore/CAMetalLayer/wantsExtendedDynamicRangeContent` on the target `QuartzCore/CAMetalLayer` has been set to `true` and a pixel format that supports EDR content has been set), this property should be set to `true` so that [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityRenderer] adjusts its tone mapping accordingly.

To control the amount of headroom available for extended dynamic range content, see [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityRenderer/extendedDynamicRangeHeadroom].

The default value is `false`.
title: extendedDynamicRangeOutput
